If you're looking for a gripping story about leadership in times of war, I'd highly recommend "Lincoln" (1995). It follows U.S President Abraham Lincoln as he navigates the Civil War and fights internal battles within his cabinet on the issue of emancipating the slaves. Daniel Day-Lewis delivers an outstanding performance in this powerful film.

For a more complex and international perspective, "In the Land of Blood and Honey" (2011) is an intriguing tale set during the Bosnian War, exploring the relationship between a soldier and a captive who once shared a promising connection. This film offers a unique take on the human cost of war.
